newsitem.title: USA: Int'l Family mulls a possible transaction. [CORRECTED 19:00 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Int'l Family mulls a possible transaction. [CORRECTED 19:00 GMT]

text.p: International Family Entertainment Inc, said today that it is in negotiations that may result in some type of deal for the broadcaster, which owns the Family Channel.

The company also said that Pat Robertson and Tim Robertson, who own all its Class A (corrects from Class B) shares -- its voting stock -- are committed that all shareholders should receive "equivalent treatment."
Class B (corrects from Class A) shares, traded publicly, do not carry voting rights.

The company said that it was disclosing the talks in response to media speculation, much of which has focused on the future of the Family Channel, one of the company's best-known assets. The company also owns FiT TV and MTM Entertainment Inc.
International Family said that it routinely talks with others about various business transactions, but has a longstanding policy not to comment until an agreement is reached.
The shares of the company traded at 24 early Friday afternoon, up 1-3/8 from Thursday's close.
